newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian average lending rate jumps to 11.1 pct.
newsitem.headline: Croatian average lending rate jumps to 11.1 pct.

text.p: Croatian average lending rate jumped to 11.1 percent from 9.9 percent on Wednesday, boosted by higher rates for short term loans.
Dealers said the demand was fully satisfied in meagre trade, with total settlement down to 14.3 million kuna against the supply of 55 million.
New borrowings were made at steady 12 and 15 percent rates for short-term loans. Call money edged up 30 basis points to 9.7 percent.
The central bank's kuna midrate for Thursday firmed to 5.43012 to the dollar and eased to 3.56210 against the mark. -- Metka Jelenc, Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
